snippet: Retail sales rose 0.4 percent in June, below the 0.8 percent increase analysts forecast, hinting at a slowdown in growth just as the Federal Reserve considers ending its stimulus program.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports retail sales rose 0.4 percent in June 2013, below the 0.8 percent increase analysts forecast, hinting at a slowdown in growth just as the Federal Reserve considers ending its stimulus program.
lead_paragraph: Retail sales rose 0.4 percent in June, below the 0.8 percent increase analysts forecast, hinting at a slowdown in growth just as the Federal Reserve considers ending its stimulus program.

headline.main: June Retail Sales Increased, but Not as Much as Expected
headline.print_headline: June Retail Sales Increased, but Not as Much as Expected
